repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Now that I've finally got the new dependencies packaged for 0.10.x, I've started running into test failures due to expectations of running with a debug build or from a git clone.

I'll adjust the CI to catch these problems and add fixes.

comment_data.body: This is an expensive fix for a problem that probably won't happen again unless we create another root traversal function. I think a better tradeoff would just be to fix the tests and call it a day.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -145,6 +145,9 @@ jobs:
           sudo cpanm -n Neovim::Ext || cat "$HOME/.cpanm/build.log"
           perl -W -e 'use Neovim::Ext; print $Neovim::Ext::VERSION'
 
+      - name: Remove .git directory
+        run: cmake -E rm -rf -- .git

comment_data.body: I'm going to fix the tests. This just helps ensure there aren't other things relying on git (like the build part of the version info). I'm not sure what's expensive about it. It takes less than a second in CI.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -145,6 +145,9 @@ jobs:
           sudo cpanm -n Neovim::Ext || cat "$HOME/.cpanm/build.log"
           perl -W -e 'use Neovim::Ext; print $Neovim::Ext::VERSION'
 
+      - name: Remove .git directory
+        run: cmake -E rm -rf -- .git

comment_data.body: I meant more the maintaining this is expensive compared to the problem, which probably won't occur again.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -145,6 +145,9 @@ jobs:
           sudo cpanm -n Neovim::Ext || cat "$HOME/.cpanm/build.log"
           perl -W -e 'use Neovim::Ext; print $Neovim::Ext::VERSION'
 
+      - name: Remove .git directory
+        run: cmake -E rm -rf -- .git

comment_data.body: Wut? Does adding `-D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release` to flags not work?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -145,14 +146,22 @@ jobs:
           sudo cpanm -n Neovim::Ext || cat "$HOME/.cpanm/build.log"
           perl -W -e 'use Neovim::Ext; print $Neovim::Ext::VERSION'
 
+      - if: ${{ matrix.build.flavor == 'release' }}
+        name: Setup Release build type
+        run: echo CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release >> $GITHUB_ENV

comment_data.body: No, because we use `make functionaltest` to run the tests. That doesn't see `build/.ran-cmake` so it re-configures the build with CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE unset, thus changing it to Debug.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -145,14 +146,22 @@ jobs:
           sudo cpanm -n Neovim::Ext || cat "$HOME/.cpanm/build.log"
           perl -W -e 'use Neovim::Ext; print $Neovim::Ext::VERSION'
 
+      - if: ${{ matrix.build.flavor == 'release' }}
+        name: Setup Release build type
+        run: echo CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release >> $GITHUB_ENV

comment_data.body: We need to fix that then in the makefile, this is pretty hacky. We can use this workaround for now though.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -145,14 +146,22 @@ jobs:
           sudo cpanm -n Neovim::Ext || cat "$HOME/.cpanm/build.log"
           perl -W -e 'use Neovim::Ext; print $Neovim::Ext::VERSION'
 
+      - if: ${{ matrix.build.flavor == 'release' }}
+        name: Setup Release build type
+        run: echo CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release >> $GITHUB_ENV

comment_data.body: We can touch the respective files earlier in the workflow. The root of the problem is we're using cmake to build and make to test.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -145,14 +146,22 @@ jobs:
           sudo cpanm -n Neovim::Ext || cat "$HOME/.cpanm/build.log"
           perl -W -e 'use Neovim::Ext; print $Neovim::Ext::VERSION'
 
+      - if: ${{ matrix.build.flavor == 'release' }}
+        name: Setup Release build type
+        run: echo CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release >> $GITHUB_ENV

comment_data.body: Yes, that was mostly to save a ci step since we can't run the oldtests with cmake. I guess it's better to just run tests directly with cmake instead anyway?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -145,14 +146,22 @@ jobs:
           sudo cpanm -n Neovim::Ext || cat "$HOME/.cpanm/build.log"
           perl -W -e 'use Neovim::Ext; print $Neovim::Ext::VERSION'
 
+      - if: ${{ matrix.build.flavor == 'release' }}
+        name: Setup Release build type
+        run: echo CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release >> $GITHUB_ENV

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  # - Check if MinSizeRel and RelWithDebInfo compiles correctly.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -194,7 +204,7 @@ jobs:
     uses: ./.github/workflows/test_windows.yml
 
   # This job tests the following things:
-  # - Check if Release, MinSizeRel and RelWithDebInfo compiles correctly.
+  # - Check if  MinSizeRel and RelWithDebInfo compiles correctly.

comment_regular_data.body:
Maybe we should remove the release step from the `build-types` job since we're already building release in this case?

```diff
diff --git a/.github/workflows/test.yml b/.github/workflows/test.yml
index 0885efddd5..d69b05dff5 100644
--- a/.github/workflows/test.yml
+++ b/.github/workflows/test.yml
@@ -194,7 +194,7 @@ jobs:
     uses: ./.github/workflows/test_windows.yml
 
   # This job tests the following things:
-  # - Check if Release, MinSizeRel and RelWithDebInfo compiles correctly.
+  # - Check if MinSizeRel and RelWithDebInfo compiles correctly.
   # - Test the above build types with the GCC compiler specifically.
   #   Empirically the difference in warning levels between GCC and other
   #   compilers is particularly big.
@@ -218,9 +218,6 @@ jobs:
       - name: Configure
         run: cmake --preset ci -G "Ninja Multi-Config"
 
-      - name: Release
-        run: cmake --build build --config Release
-
       - name: RelWithDebInfo
         run: cmake --build build --config RelWithDebInfo
 
```

labels.description: automation for build, test, and release
labels.name: ci

title: Fix test failures for release / tarball builds
